Journal.Title: The journal of physical chemistry. A

Article.ArticleTitle: Atmospheric Chemistry of 1H-Heptafluorocyclopentene (cyc-CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF═CH-): Rate Constant, Products, and Mechanism of Gas-Phase Reactions with OH Radicals, IR Absorption Spectrum, Photochemical Ozone Creation Potential, and Global Warming Potential.

AbstractText: The rate constant for gas-phase reactions of OH radicals with 1H-heptafluorocyclopentene (cyc-CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF═CH-) was measured using a relative rate method at 298 K: (5.20 ± 0.09) × 10<sup>-14</sup> cm<sup>3</sup> molecule<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>. The quoted uncertainty includes two standard deviations from the least-squares regression, the systematic error from the GC analysis, and the uncertainties of the rate constants of the reference compounds. The OH-radical-initiated oxidation of cyc-CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF═CH- gives the main products COF<sub>2</sub>, CO, and CO<sub>2</sub>, leading to negligible environmental impact. For consumptions of cyc-CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF═CH- of less than 54%, the yield of the formation of ([COF<sub>2</sub>] + [CO] + [CO<sub>2</sub>])/5 (based on the conservation of carbon) was 0.99 ± 0.02, which is very close to 100%. A possible degradation mechanism was proposed. The radiative efficiency (RE) of cyc-CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF═CH- measured at room temperature was 0.215 W m<sup>-2</sup> ppb<sup>-1</sup>. The atmospheric lifetime of cyc-CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF<sub>2</sub>CF═CH- was calculated as 0.61 year, and the photochemical ozone creation potential (POCP) was negligible. The 20-, 100-, and 500-year time horizon global warming potentials (GWPs) were estimated as 153, 42, and 12, respectively.
